parameters.content:
Quick-Start Telegram Echo Bot

A single-node Telegram bot that parses /help, /summary <URL>, or /img <prompt> and returns either a help menu, a 10‚Äì12-point article summary, or an ‚Äúimage in progress‚Äù acknowledgement.

Listener

Watches for any new message from Telegram and kicks the flow off.

Command Router

Checks if the message starts with /help, /summary, or /img, and sends it down the right path.

Help Responder

When it sees /help, replies with a simple list of commands and how to use them.

Summary Checker

Sees if the text begins with /summary. If yes, it moves on to fetch the article; if no, skips onward.

Fetcher

Goes to the provided URL and downloads the page‚Äôs HTML.

Image Prompt Checker

Sees if the text begins with /img. If yes, forwards the prompt to the image generator; if not, ends the flow.

Text Extractor

Pulls out just the main article text (e.g. everything inside <body>).

Image Generator

Sends your prompt to OpenAI‚Äôs image endpoint (or your chosen image API).

Summarizer

Sends the raw article text to OpenAI and asks for a 10‚Äì12-point professional bullet-point summary.

Image Acknowledger

Tells the user ‚ÄúGot it‚Äîyour image is being made!‚Äù (and later you can hook this up to send the actual picture URL).

Summary Sender

Delivers the bullet-point summary back to the user in Telegram.

parameters.text:
ü§ñ *Help Menu*

Use `/summary <link>` to summarize an article.
Use `/img <prompt>` to generate an image.

_Example:_
/summary https://example.com
/img a futuristic cityscape
üñºÔ∏è Generated image prompt submitted! Gemini image model doesn't return images directly. Use image generation APIs like Stability for actual image URLs.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
